result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Akaylah I. Lira

records.addlTxt: Letter Atty Birenbaum Re: Filing Notice of Retainer and Discovery Demand

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Clerk emailed Atty Birenbaum regarding being appointed to this case, Atty Birenbaum accepted appointment and will represent Defendant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:17 AM Cases called 22CM307 and 22CM308 - Defendant Akaylah I. Lira in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges/penalties. Defendant files petition for court appointed attorney. Court examines Defendant and finds Defendant indigent.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: $500 signature bond on each case-22CM307 & 22CM308 - Curfew 8:00 pm to 7:00 am daily -  no exceptions must remain in the home during these hours. No violent contact with anyone including victim. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia.

1:27 PM Cases 22CM307/ 22CM308 called together - 1:06 PM Defendant Akaylah I. Lira in court in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Rachel Boaz, appearing as friend of the Court. Atty. Antonella Aleman Zientek appears fore the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause on each case.  Court advised defendant of complaint, defense waives reading of complaint, does not qualify for PD. State recommendation of $500  signature bond. Court orders $500 signature bond w/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
